He can stay with us as long as he wants, even when he retires...Let him decide what he wants,\" he said.\n\nMessi has chance to win a third straight major title with his national side following their 2022 World Cup triumph and their 2021 Copa America win.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner referenced veteran team-mates Di Maria and Nicolas Otamendi and said that the success was validation for the difficult barren years the team had suffered.\n\n\"The truth is that it's crazy what this group has done, what the Argentina national team has been doing, because after all this it gives value to all (the tournaments) I and the old generation have played in,\" Messi said on TyC Sports.\n\n\"It's not easy for us to be in a final again, for us to compete again to be champions,\" he added after the victory at MetLife Stadium.\n\nDespite Argentina reaching the final with some comfort against Canada, the former Barcelona forward said it had been a tough test so far.\n\n\"It's a difficult Copa, evenly matched, with very bad pitches, with high temperatures, very tough teams, and for us to be in a final again is something to enjoy,\" he said.\n\nGoalkeeper Emiliano Martinez said that despite being world champions the joy of reaching a final was just as intense as ever.\n\n\"It's a source of pride as an Argentine, as a representative of this national team, to be able to play in another final. {"uri": "8218593921", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "11:26:40", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T11:26:40Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T11:26:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8039215803146362, "url": "https://houstonianonline.com/copa-america-2024-argentina-beat-canada-2-0-to-reach-final-messi-scores/", "title": "Copa America 2024: Argentina beat Canada 2-0 to reach final, Messi scores", "body": "EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) -- Lionel Messi and Argentina are on the verge of joining Spain as the only two nations to win three straight major tournaments.\n\n\"What this team has done is crazy, what the Argentine national team is doing is crazy,\" Messi said Tuesday night after scoring his 109th international goal in a 2-0 win over Canada to secure a place in this week's Copa America final. \"For those of us who are still from the old guard, to have the national team reach another final is impressive.\"\n\nJulian Alvarez puts Argentina ahead In the 22nd minute, he controlled a long pass from Rodrigo De Paul, evaded Moise Pompetto twice and put the ball through goalkeeper Maxime Cr\u00e9peau's legs for his ninth international goal.\n\nMessi converts Enzo Fernandez's shot Messi scored his first goal of the tournament after Ismael Kone's four-yard shot was blocked by Crepeau in the 51st minute. Messi has scored 28 goals in his last 25 appearances for Argentina and 14 at the Copa America, three short of the record. He has also scored against 38 different countries.\n\n\"I wasn't sure Enzo's ball would go in. It was just a reaction,\" Messi said.\n\nOnly Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo, with 130 goals, has more international goals than Messi, who turned 37 on June 24. Iran's Ali Daei scored 108 or 109 goals between 1993 and 2006, with an ongoing dispute over whether his goal against Ecuador in 2000 occurred in a full international.\n\nWith its Independence Day win, Argentina extended its unbeaten run to 10 matches. Argentina will be looking to win its 16th Copa America title when it faces either Uruguay or Colombia on Sunday in Miami Gardens, Florida.\n\n\"We have to enjoy every moment of our current life. I know that these are the last battles,\" Messi said.\n\nIn their bid to combine the Copa America and 2022 World Cup titles, Argentina hopes to match Spain's achievement of winning the 2008 and 2012 European Championships as well as the 2010 World Cup.\n\n\"These are just statistics. I'm not really interested in them. The most important thing is to win,\" Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni said through a translator.\n\nIn his 38th Copa America appearance, Messi missed the group stage final with Argentina due to a leg injury and did not perform well during his 90 minutes in the match. Quarter-final win over EcuadorHe was more agile and fired two shots that went wide of the post in the 12th and 44th minutes.\n\nMessi touched the ball 45 times and his pass success rate was 79%.\n\n\"They make us pay for small details,\" Crepeau said.\n\nThe temporary turf surface at MetLife Stadium looked heavy, with water splashing and sand appearing during the dribble.\n\n\"The Copa America was very difficult, the competition was intense, the surfaces were bad and the temperature was high,\" Messi said.\n\nArgentina fans gathered in Times Square on the eve of the game and filled the streets of Manhattan before heading to MetLife Stadium. The crowd of 80,102 on a night of 82 degrees and 82 percent humidity was overwhelmingly pro-Argentina, with red-clad Canadian fans taking up only a few sections of the stands.\n\nThe match was among the biggest for Canadian soccer, which lost 6-0 in its only World Cup appearances in 1986 and 2022 and won its only major title at the CONCACAF Gold Cup in 2000. Argentina had beaten Canada 2-0 in the final. Opening of the tournament On June 20.\n\n\"The tournament has affected us a little bit,\" Canada coach Jesse Marsch said. \"There was heat, there was travel, there were a lot of challenges... We're still early in our process, right? Argentina has probably been together for eight years, seven years with this team, so we need to develop more players who can contribute so we can also rotate in the tournament, because eventually the physicality and fatigue can catch up with you.\"\n\nCanadian star Alphonso Davies left the match in the 71st minute after suffering an injury to his right leg in a clean tackle with Gonzalo Montiel.\n\n\"He'll have an X-ray, so hopefully he'll be okay, but we're not sure,\" Marsh said.\n\nCanada had two shots on target, with Emiliano Martinez saving Jonathan David's close-range effort in first-half stoppage time and Martinez also stopping a shot from Tani Oluwasi in the 89th minute.\n\n\"We started making mistakes. We started getting away from the game plan,\" said defender Derek Cornelius, who swapped shirts with Messi.\n\nWhile Messi referred to the \"last battles,\" Scaloni and his fans hope Argentina and Messi return to MetLife for the 2026 World Cup final.\n\n\"We will never be the ones to close the door. He can stay with our team as long as he wants,\" Scaloni said.", "source": {"uri": "houstonianonline.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "houstonianonline.com"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": {"uri": "8219092320", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:46:33", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:46:33Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:46:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7882353067398071, "url": "https://worldsoccertalk.com/copa-america/will-messi-retire-from-argentina-after-copa-star-reveals-decision/", "title": "Will Messi retire from Argentina after Copa? Star reveals decision", "body": "Lionel Messi has expressed his intention to continue playing for Argentina beyond the upcoming Copa America final.\n\nMessi has an impressive record of accomplishments throughout his time with Argentina. He was an integral part of his country's 2022 World Cup, and 2021 Copa America. The veteran also played in the revived 2022 Cup of Champions, which they won with a 3-0 victory against Mexico.\n\nThe superstar won the gold medal in the 2008 Beijing Olympics, adding to his collection of honors. Now, after defeating Canada 2-0 to go to the Copa America final, he is in a prime position to capture another major international trophy.\n\nThe 37-year-old made it to 109 goals for his country, his first in the competition so far this year. Now he's three goals short of the record for most in Copa America play, with fourteen. Right before the final whistle, the Inter Miami star had to cover his face with his hands to control his tears. It would be fitting for him to end his career on a high note by winning the Copa America, given everything he has accomplished.\n\nBut after the game, Messi stated, \"As I've said before, I intend to continue. I intend to keep living day by day without thinking about what will come in the future or whether I'll continue or not. It's something I just live each day. I'm 37 years and only God knows when the end will be.\"\n\nMessi, who scored his 109th international goal against Canada, has had a remarkable career with Argentina. He reversed his retirement decision after the 2016 Copa America final. Since then, he has scored 54 goals in 73 international appearances. His contributions helped Argentina win the 2021 Copa America and the 2022 World Cup. That solidified his legacy as one of the greatest players in the sport's history.\n\nThe journey of Lionel Scaloni's players to this edition of the Copa America final has been impressive. They reached their sixth final in eight editions of the tournament, with the 37-year-old playing a crucial role. Julian Alvarez gave Argentina the lead against Canada, and Messi extended it in the second half. This performance exemplifies the strong form Argentina has maintained under Messi's leadership.\n\nFor now, Messi remains focused on enjoying his time on the field and cherishing the moments with his team. He acknowledged the importance of savoring these experiences, especially as he and some of his teammates like Angel Di Maria are near the end of their international careers. Di Maria has confirmed that this will be his final tournament with Argentina. That adds a sentimental layer to their pursuit of another title.\n\nArgentina's head coach, Lionel Scaloni, had previously emphasized that Messi's place in the national team is secure for as long as he desires. \"We have to let him be and we will never be the ones to close the door. He can be with our team for as long as he wants to be.\"\n\nLa Seleccion will face either Uruguay or Colombia in the Copa America final. Messi and his teammates are focused on securing their third major title in three years, following their Copa America and World Cup triumphs. As they prepare for the final, Messi's message to his fans and teammates is clear: enjoy these moments and appreciate the journey.", "source": {"uri": "worldsoccertalk.com", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "8218096433", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "06:03:08", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T06:03:08Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T06:02:49Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7882353067398071, "url": "https://www.deccanchronicle.com/sports/football/these-are-the-last-battles-im-enjoying-them-says-messi-ahead-of-copa-america-final-1809449", "title": "These Are The Last battles, I'm Enjoying Them, Says Messi Ahead of Copa America Final", "body": "East Rutherford: Argentina Captain Lionel Messi said that he was enjoying his \"last battles\" with the team after scoring a goal against Canada in the semifinals of the Copa America 2024.\n\nMessi has scored his first goal in this tournament after a lacklustre display against Ecuador in the quarterfinals.\n\n\"I'm living it like I lived it in the last Copa America, in the last World Cup....these are the last battles and I'm enjoying them to the maximum,\" Messi told TyC Sports after the win against Canada.\n\nLionel Messi, currently playing for Major League Soccer Club Inter Miami, has yet to confirm whether he will represent Argentina in the 2026 FIFA World Cup.\n\n\"The truth is that it's crazy what this group has done, what the Argentina national team has been doing, because after all this it gives value to all (the tournaments) I and the old generation have played in,\" said Messi.\n\n\"It's not easy for us to be in a final again, for us to compete again to be champions,\" he added.\n\nMessi said that so far the Copa America has been tough for them. \"It's a difficult Copa, evenly matched, with very bad pitches, with high temperatures, very tough teams, and for us to be in a final again is something to enjoy,\" he said.\n\nArgentina coach Lionel Scaloni was asked about Messi's \"last battles\" comment, his reply was to leave the Argentina legend alone. \"We have to leave him alone, he knows that we will not be the ones to close the door on him. {"uri": "8218254886", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "07:57:22", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T07:57:22Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T07:56:50Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7882353067398071, "url": "https://www.dailysabah.com/sports/football/messi-hits-109th-goal-as-argentina-beat-canada-for-copa-america-final", "title": "Messi hits 109th goal as Argentina beat Canada for Copa America final", "body": "Lionel Messi and Argentina are just one win away from matching Spain's record of three consecutive major titles.\n\n\"This team's achievements are extraordinary; what the Argentina national team is accomplishing is beyond words,\" Messi said Tuesday night after scoring his 109th international goal, securing a 2-0 victory over Canada and a spot in this weekend's Copa America final. \"For those of us from the old guard, it's incredibly impressive to see the national team in another final.\"\n\nJulian Alvarez put the Albiceleste ahead in the 22nd minute, controlling a long pass from Rodrigo De Paul, taking two touches to get away from Mo\u00efse Bombito and slipping the ball through the legs of goalkeeper Maxime Crepeau for his ninth international goal.\n\nMessi redirected Enzo Fernandez's shot following a poor Ismael Kone clearance in off the face of Crepeau from 4 yards in the 51st for his first goal of the tournament. Messi has 28 goals in his last 25 matches for Argentina and 14 in Copa America play, three shy of the record. He has scored against 38 different nations.\n\n\"I wasn't sure if Enzo's ball was going to get in,\" Messi said. \"It was a reflex.\"\n\nOnly Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo, with 130, has more international goals than Messi, who turned 37 on June 24. Iran's Ali Daei had 108 or 109 from 1993 to 2006, with a lingering dispute over whether a goal against Ecuador in 2000 occurred in a full international match.\n\nWith a victory on its Independence Day, Argentina extended its unbeaten streak to 10 games. The Albiceleste seek a record 16th Copa title when they play Uruguay or Colombia on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida.\n\n\"We have to enjoy every moment of what we're living,\" Messi said. \"I'm conscious that these are the last battles.\"\n\nTrying to string together Copa America titles around the 2022 World Cup championship, Argentina hopes to match Spain's feat of winning the 2008 and 2012 European Championships along with the 2010 World Cup.\n\n\"These are statistics. I'm not really interested in them,\" Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni said through a translator. \"The most important thing is to win.\"\n\nMaking his 38th Copa America appearance, Messi had missed Argentina's group stage finale with a leg injury and was subdued while playing 90 minutes in the quarterfinal win over Ecuador. He was much more agile and shot just wide in the 12th and 44th minutes.\n\nMetLife's temporary grass surface appeared heavy, with water splashing and sand popping up during dribbles.\n\n\"It has been a very difficult Copa America,\" Messi said. \"Very competitive, bad surfaces, excessive heat.\"\n\nArgentina fans gathered in Times Square on the eve of the match and filled the streets of Manhattan before heading to MetLife Stadium. The crowd of 80,102 on a night with an 82-degree temperature and 82% humidity was overwhelmingly pro-Argentina, with only a few sections dominated by red-clad Canadian supporters.\n\nIt was among the biggest games for Canadian soccer, which went 0-6 in its only World Cup appearances in 1986 and 2022 and won its only major title at the 2000 CONCACAF Gold Cup. Argentina had beaten Canada 2-0 in the tournament opener on June 20.\n\n\"The tournament caught up with us a little bit,\" Canada coach Jesse Marsch said. \"There's been heat, there's been travel, there's been a lot of challenges. ... We're still at the beginnings of our process, right? Argentina's maybe had eight years together, seven years together with this team, and so we need to develop more players that can contribute so that we can also rotate in tournament play because eventually the physicality and the fatigue can catch up with you.\"\n\nCanada star Alphonso Davies limped off in the 71st minute after his right leg was caught in a clean challenge with Gonzalo Montiel.\n\n\"He's getting an X-ray, so we're hopeful he's OK, but we're not sure,\" Marsch said.\n\nCanada had two shots on target: Jonathan David was thwarted by Emiliano Mart\u00ednez from close range in first-half stoppage time, and Mart\u00ednez made a kick save on Tani Oluwaseyi in the 89th.\n\n\"We started getting sloppy. We started getting away from the game plan,\" said defender Derek Cornelius, who exchanged jerseys with Messi.\n\nWhile Messi referred to \"last battles,\" Scaloni and fans hold out hope Argentina and Messi will return to MetLife for the 2026 World Cup final.\n\n\"We will never be the ones to close the door,\" Scaloni said. \"He can be with our team for as long as he wants to be.\"", "source": {"uri": "8218069013", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "05:39:28", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T05:39:28Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T05:39:07Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7882353067398071, "url": "https://www.timesfreepress.com/news/2024/jul/09/argentina-beats-canada-to-reach-copa-america-final/", "title": "Argentina beats Canada to reach Copa America final", "body": "EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. -- Lionel Messi scored the 109th goal of his international career and his first of this year's Copa America, leading reigning tournament champion Argentina over Canada on Tuesday night, 2-0, and into the title match.\n\nJuli\u00e1n \u00c1lvarez put the Albiceleste ahead in the 22nd minute, and Messi redirected Enzo Fern\u00e1ndez's shot in off the face of goalkeeper Maxime Cr\u00e9peau in the 51st. Messi has 28 goals in his past 25 matches for Argentina and 14 in Copa America play, three shy of the record.\n\nOnly Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo with 130 has more international goals than Messi, who turned 37 on June 24. Iran's Al Daei had 108 or 109 from 1993 to 2006, with a lingering dispute over whether his score against Ecuador in 2000 occurred in a full international match.\n\nWith a victory on its independence day, Argentina extended its unbeaten streak to 10 games. The Albiceleste will be seeking a record 16th Copa America title when they play the winner of Wednesday's semifinal between Colombia and Uruguay on Sunday in Miami Gardens, Florida.\n\n\"We have to enjoy every moment of what we're are living,\" Messi said. \"I'm conscious that these are the last battles.\"\n\nWith a chance to sandwich its 2022 World Cup title with consecutive Copa America crowns, Argentina is trying for a feat similar to when Spain won the 2008 and 2012 Euro championships along with the 2010 World Cup. If they pull it off, the Albiceleste would join La Roja as the only nations to win three straight major titles.\n\n\"It's insane what this team has done, what the Argentina national team is doing,\" Messi said. \"For those who remain from the old guard, it's beyond impressive that the national team is in another final.\"\n\nArgentina coach Lionel Scaloni, speaking through a translator, wasn't ready to reflect on something that hadn't yet happened.\n\n\"These are statistics. I'm not really interested about it,\" he said. \"The most important thing is to win.\"\n\nOn a night when the temperature was 82 degrees with 82% humidity at MetLife Stadium, the site of the 2026 World Cup final, the crowd of 80,102 was overwhelmingly rooting for Argentina, with only a few sections dominated by red-clad supporters of Canada.\n\nIt was one of the biggest soccer matches ever for the Canada men's national team, which went 0-6 in its only World Cup appearances in 1986 and 2022 and won its only major title at the 2000 CONCACAF Gold Cup. Argentina also beat Canada 2-0 in the Copa America opener for both teams on June 20.\n\nCanada star Alphonso Davies limped off after his right leg was caught in a clean challenge with Gonzalo Montiel, and he was replaced in the 71st minute.\n\n\"The tournament caught up with us a little bit,\" Canada coach Jesse Marsch said. \"There's been heat, there's been travel, there's been a lot of challenges. ... We're still at the beginnings of our process, right? Argentina's maybe had eight years together, seven years together with this team, and so we need to develop more players that can contribute so that we can also rotate in tournament play, because eventually the physicality and the fatigue can catch up with you.\"\n\nMessi, who made his 38th Copa America appearance, had missed Argentina's group stage finale with a leg injury and was subdued while playing 90 minutes in the quarterfinal win over Ecuador.\n\nAgainst Canada, he was just wide from the top of the penalty area in the 12th minute after exchanging passes with \u00c1ngel Di Mar\u00eda, then wide again in the 44th, and he put a chip over the crossbar in first-half injury time.\n\nMessi had 45 touches and a 79% pass success rate.\n\n\"They make us pay on small details,\" Cr\u00e9peau said.\n\nMetLife's temporary grass surface appeared heavy, with water splashing and sand popping up during dribbles.\n\n\"It's has been a very difficult Copa Am\u00e9rica, very competitive, bad surfaces, excessive heat,\" Messi said.\n\nArgentina went ahead after Rodrigo De Paul, who was at the center circle, played a long pass to \u00c1lvarez, who took a touch at the top of the arc to control the ball against Canada's Mo\u00efse Bombito. \u00c1lvarez took another touch to create space from Bombito and from near the penalty spot slipped the ball between the legs of Cr\u00e9peau for his ninth goal in 35 international appearances.\n\nMessi scored after a throw-in. He centered the ball to De Paul, who ran to the end line and cut the ball back. Kon\u00e9's attempted clearance went to Fern\u00e1ndez, who teed up a shot that Messi redirected from just inside the 6-yard box.\n\n\"I just put myself in the middle of it,\" Messi said. \"I wasn't sure if Enzo's ball was going to get in. It was a reflex.\"\n\nCanada had two shots on target: Jonathan David was thwarted by Emiliano Mart\u00ednez from close range in first-half stoppage time, and Mart\u00ednez made a kick save on Tani Oluwaseyi in the 89th.\n\n\"We started getting sloppy. We started getting away from the game plan,\" said defender Derek Cornelius, who exchanged jerseys with Messi.\n\nWhile the Argentina star referred to \"last battles,\" Scaloni and fans hold out hope the team and Messi will return to this same venue for the 2026 World Cup final.\n\n\"We will never be the ones to close the door,\" Scaloni said. \"He can be with our team for as long as he wants to {"uri": "2024-07-416942931", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "04:53:28", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T04:53:28Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T02:01:58Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7803921699523926, "url": "https://tribtown.com/2024/07/09/messis-109th-goal-leads-defending-champion-argentina-over-canada-2-0-and-into-copa-america-final/", "title": "Messi's 109th goal leads defending champion Argentina over Canada 2-0 and into Copa America final", "body": "EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) -- Lionel Messi and Argentina moved within one win of joining Spain as the only nations to win three straight major titles.\n\n\"It's insane what this team has done, what the Argentina national team is doing,\" Messi said Tuesday night after his 109th international goal sealed a 2-0 victory over Canada that earned a berth in this weekend's Copa America final. \"For those who remain from the old guard, it's beyond impressive that the national team is in another final.\"\n\nJuli\u00e1n \u00c1lvarez put the Albiceleste ahead in the 22nd minute, controlling a long pass from Rodrigo De Paul, taking two touches to get away from Mo\u00efse Bombito and slipping the ball through the legs of goalkeeper Maxime Cr\u00e9peau for his ninth international goal.\n\nMessi redirected Enzo Fern\u00e1ndez's shot following a poor Isma\u00ebl Kon\u00e9 clearance in off the face of Cr\u00e9peau from 4 yards in the 51st for his first goal of the tournament. Messi has 28 goals in his last 25 matches for Argentina and 14 in Copa America play, three shy of the record. He has scored against 38 different nations.\n\n\"I wasn't sure if Enzo's ball was going to get in,\" Messi said. \"It was a reflex.\"\n\nOnly Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo with 130 has more international goals than Messi, who turned 37 on June 24. Iran's Ali Daei had 108 or 109 from 1993 to 2006, with a lingering dispute over whether a goal against Ecuador in 2000 occurred in a full international match.\n\nWith a victory on its independence day, Argentina extended its unbeaten streak to 10 games. The Albiceleste seek a record 16th Copa title when they play Uruguay or Colombia on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida.\n\n\"We have to enjoy every moment of what we're are living,\" Messi said. \"I'm conscious that these are the last battles.\"\n\nTrying to string together Copa America titles around the 2022 World Cup championship, Argentina hopes to match Spain's feat of winning the 2008 and 2012 European Championships along with the 2010 World Cup.\n\n\"These are statistics. I'm not really interested about it,\" Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni said through a translator. \"The most important thing is to win.\"\n\nMaking his 38th Copa America appearance, Messi had missed Argentina's group stage finale with a leg injury and was subdued while playing 90 minutes in the quarterfinal win over Ecuador. He was much more agile and shot just wide in the 12th and 44th minutes.\n\nMetLife's temporary grass surface appeared heavy, with water splashing and sand popping up during dribbles.\n\n\"It's has been a very difficult Copa Am\u00e9rica,\" Messi said, \"very competitive, bad surfaces, excessive heat.\"\n\nArgentina fans gathered in Times Square on the eve of the match and filled the streets on Manhattan before heading to MetLife Stadium. The crowd of 80,102 on a night with an 82-degree temperature and 82% humidity was overwhelmingly pro-Argentina, with only a few sections dominated by red-clad Canadian supporters.\n\nIt was among the biggest games for Canadian soccer, which went 0-6 in its only World Cup appearances in 1986 and 2022 and won its only major title at the 2000 CONCACAF Gold Cup. Argentina had beaten Canada 2-0 in the tournament opener on June 20.\n\n\"The tournament caught up with us a little bit,\" Canada coach Jesse Marsch said. \"There's been heat, there's been travel, there's been a lot of challenges. ... We're still at the beginnings of our process, right? Argentina's maybe had eight years together, seven years together with this team, and so we need to develop more players that can contribute so that we can also rotate in tournament play, because eventually the physicality and the fatigue can catch up with you.\"\n\nCanada star Alphonso Davies limped off in the 71st minute after his right leg was caught in a clean challenge with Gonzalo Montiel.\n\n\"He's getting an X-ray, so we're hopeful he's OK, but we're not sure,\" Marsch said.\n\nCanada had two shots on target: Jonathan David was thwarted by Emiliano Mart\u00ednez from close range in first-half stoppage time, and Mart\u00ednez made a kick save on Tani Oluwaseyi in the 89th.\n\n\"We started getting sloppy. We started getting away from the game plan,\" said defender Derek Cornelius, who exchanged jerseys with Messi.\n\nWhile Messi referred to \"last battles,\" Scaloni and fans hold out hope Argentina and Messi will return to MetLife for the 2026 World Cup final.\n\n\"We will never be the ones to close the door,\" Scaloni said. \"He can be with our team for as long as he wants to be.\"", "source": It marked Messi's first goal of the tournament.Source : X/ @Argentina\n\nArgentina vs Canada Copa America 2024 Semifinal: Argentina defeated Canada 2-0 in the Copa America 2024 semifinal at MetLife Stadium in New Jersey on July 9 (Tuesday), advancing to their second consecutive final. The defending champions' victory was led by goals from Julian Alvarez and captain Lionel Messi, who scored his first goal of the tournament. Argentina will now face either Uruguay or Colombia, who play on Wednesday, in the final on Sunday in Miami Gardens, Florida.\n\nArgentina absorbed early pressure before Alvarez slipped between two defenders to score with a tidy finish in the 22nd minute. Messi, who had multiple chances throughout the match, doubled the lead in the 51st minute by redirecting Enzo Fernandez's shot past Canada goalkeeper Maxime Crepeau.\n\nALSO ON ABP Live | India Women Vs South Africa Women T20I Series: Hosts Win 3rd T20I By 10 Wickets, Series Ends 1-1\n\nMessi scored his 109th international goal, bringing his tally to 28 goals in his last 25 matches for Argentina and 14 in Copa America. Lionel Messi also climbed to second place on the all-time list of international goalscorers with his 109th goal, surpassing Iran's Ali Daei. The 37-year-old now trails only Cristiano Ronaldo, who tops the charts with 130 goals in international football.\n\nMaking his 38th Copa America appearance, Messi had missed Argentina's group stage finale with a leg injury and was subdued during the quarterfinal win over Ecuador. He narrowly missed from the top of the penalty area in the 12th minute after exchanging passes with Angel Di Maria and had other near misses in the 44th minute and first-half injury time.\n\nALSO READ | Euro 2024: Lamine Yamal Creates History, Becomes Youngest Ever Starter In Tournament Semis\n\nWith this victory Argentina extended their unbeaten streak to 10 games. Argentina are now aiming for a record 16th Copa title. Now in the Copa America final, they seek to match Spain's feat of winning consecutive championships, having won the 2008 and 2012 European Championships and the 2010 World Cup, by securing {"uri": "2024-07-417319646", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "11:02:19", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T11:02:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T10:29:07Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7764706015586853, "url": "https://eu.usatoday.com/story/sports/soccer/2024/07/10/lionel-messi-argentina-copa-america-final/74347973007/", "title": "Messi enjoying 'last battles' to fullest as Argentina reaches Copa America final", "body": "Fans of Colombia's men's soccer team dominated in the seats at State Farm Stadium in Glendale Friday afternoon for the Colombia-Costa Rica Copa America game.\n\nLionel Messi, his legendary left foot louder than his soft-spoken voice, sent a message to his legion of fans after Argentina reached the Copa America 2024 final.\n\nEnjoy this moment, these moments, while they last.\n\nMessi scored a quirky goal, and Argentina defeated Canada, 2-0, in its Copa America semifinal on Tuesday night to set the stage for Messi and Argentina soccer to be remembered as one of the sport's all-time great dynasties.\n\nThe Copa America final is Sunday at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami, against Colombia or Uruguay, pending Wednesday night's semifinal.\n\n\"It's crazy what this group did, what the Argentine national team has been doing. After this, much more importance will be given to all the finals that I and the old group had to play in,\" Messi said following the match at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey.\n\n\"We have to enjoy everything we are experiencing as a national team. What we have achieved is very difficult. We have to take advantage of it.\"\n\nMessi's life changed since his World Cup win.\n\nAnd before it changes again - with the 2026 World Cup or retirement in the near distance - he wants to soak it all in during this Copa America run to the final.\n\n\"These are the last battles, and I am enjoying them to the fullest,\" Messi said.\n\nNot just for him, but for his teammates like \u00c1ngel Di Mar\u00eda, the big-game scorer Messi needed to get the international monkey off his back. The Copa America final will be Di Mar\u00eda's final match with the Argentine national team.\n\n\"Before going out on the field, Leo said they wanted to reach the final for me, and that fills me with pride,\" Di Mar\u00eda said. \"Having that possibility of being able to achieve everything I achieved this last time with all of them is a source of pride for me.\"\n\nMessi also wants Argentine fans who have grown accustomed to their winning, the same ones who bemoaned him for not being able to win Copa America or the World Cup, to enjoy these moments.\n\nArgentina was a favorite to reach this final, fulfilling this sort of comfortable destiny and reputation of being World Cup champions.\n\nSure, a game-tying goal against Ecuador in the quarterfinals last week went to penalties, and Messi missed his shot. But no need to panic. Never a doubt.\n\nArgentina outmatched Canada, which earned the prize of meeting with the international juggernaut by outlasting the likes of Brazil, Venezuela and the United States to reach the Copa America final four.\n\n\"Yesterday, one of my colleagues was saying maybe we are normalizing these,\" Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni said. \"It is extremely tough to reach another final. We are carrying over a great level of praise with great success. We know how hard it is to get here.\"\n\nArgentina won Copa America 2021. It beat the Euro 2021 champions, Italy, in the 2022 Finalissima two summers ago. Argentina won the Qatar World Cup in 2022. Another Copa America crown would be Argentina's fourth major international championship in a three-year span.\n\nMessi wants his fans to savor and remember: This is a fleeting moment. Not everything lasts. He can tell you best.\n\nMessi's international success - the success he longed for his entire career when he was a Barcelona star - followed his Barcelona exit in 2021.\n\nAll that's left is Barcelona memories of his four UEFA Champions League crowns, seven Copa del Rey titles and 10 La Liga titles - appreciated more after his sour Paris Saint-Germain stint.\n\nAnd whether Messi plays in the next World Cup will depend on his health and desire, as he's indicated.\n\n\"We have to let him be,\" Scaloni said of Messi's comments. \"We will never be the ones to close the door. He can be with our team with as long as he wants to be.\"\n\nMessi hasn't closed the door just yet. He can stay with us as long as he wants, even when he retires...Let him decide what he wants,\" he said.\n\nMessi has chance to win a third straight major title with his national side following their 2022 World Cup triumph and their 2021 Copa America win.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner referenced veteran team-mates Di Maria and Nicolas Otamendi and said that the success was validation for the difficult barren years the team had suffered.\n\nREAD MORE | Copa America 2024: Lionel Messi becomes all-time second highest international goalscorer\n\n\"The truth is that it's crazy what this group has done, what the Argentina national team has been doing, because after all this it gives value to all (the tournaments) I and the old generation have played in,\" Messi said on TyC Sports.\n\n\"It's not easy for us to be in a final again, for us to compete again to be champions,\" he added after the victory at MetLife Stadium.\n\nDespite Argentina reaching the final with some comfort against Canada, the former Barcelona forward said it had been a tough test so far.\n\n\"It's a difficult Copa, evenly matched, with very bad pitches, with high temperatures, very tough teams, and for us to be in a final again is something to enjoy,\" he said.\n\nGoalkeeper Emiliano Martinez said that despite being world champions the joy of reaching a final was just as intense as ever.\n\n\"It's a source of pride as an Argentine, as a representative of this national team, to be able to play in another final. Superstar drops a hint after Argentina reach Copa America final", "body": "Lionel Messi of Argentina smiles during the semifinal match against Canada. -- AFP\n\nDefending champions Argentina booked their place in the Copa America final after goals from Julian Alvarez and Lionel Messi gave them a 2-0 win over Canada in Tuesday's semifinal in New Jersey.\n\nArgentina will face either Uruguay or Colombia in Sunday's final in Florida, a match that could represent the last shot at silverware for several senior squad members including Messi, Angel Di Maria and Nicolas Otamendi.\n\nMessi, 37, admitted after the match that the final on Sunday could be the last international match for some of the veterans in the team.\n\n\"Let's enjoy what we are experiencing as a national team, as a group. It is not easy to be in a final again, to compete again to be champions. I'm living it as I have been living everything lately: enjoying it very much and being aware, as it happens to Fideo (Di Maria) and Ota (Otamendi), that these are the last battles,\" Messi told TyC Sports in an apparent hint at retirement following the Copa America.\n\nArgentina have won a joint-record 15 Copa titles and reached the final six times in the past eight editions but Canada caused them real problems in the opening 20 minutes, Jacob Shaffelburg twice shooting wide from promising positions.\n\nAfter soaking up the early pressure, though, Argentina went ahead when Rodrigo De Paul played through Alvarez, who ghosted in between two defenders to score with a tidy finish in the 22nd minute.\n\nArgentina, 2022 World Cup winners and number one in Fifa's rankings, gradually took control and Messi had a chance to double their lead in the 44th minute when he created space in the box with some silky footwork before lashing his effort wide.\n\nCanada nearly snatched an equaliser against the run of play in first-half stoppage time as Jonathan David sneaked in ahead of his marker to get on the end of a long throw, but his close-range shot was hit straight at goalkeeper Emiliano Martinez.\n\nMessi had struggled with a muscle injury earlier in the tournament but appeared revitalised on a hot and humid evening at the MetLife Stadium.\n\nHe scored Argentina's second in the 51st minute, sticking out a boot to divert Enzo Fernandez's shot from the edge of the area past Canada goalkeeper Maxime Crepeau.\n\nThe goal moved Messi to joint fifth in the all-time Copa America scoring charts, level with Peru's Paolo Guerrero and Chile's Eduardo Vargas, on 14.\n\nHis 109th goal for Argentina also saw him surpass Iran's Ali Daei to take sole possession of second place on the all-time international scoring charts. {"uri": "8218169349", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "06:59:27", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T06:59:27Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T06:59:04Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7647058963775635, "url": "https://www.etvbharat.com/en/!sports/argentina-sails-into-copa-america-final-lionel-messis-109th-goal-helps-defending-champion-beat-canada-enn24071002390", "title": "Argentina Sails Into Copa America Final, Lionel Messi's 109th Goal Helps Defending Champion Beat Canada", "body": "East Rutherford (US): Lionel Messi and Argentina moved within one win of joining Spain as the only nations to win three straight major titles.\n\n\"It's insane what this team has done, what the Argentina national team is doing,\" Messi said on Tuesday night after his 109th international goal sealed a 2-0 victory over Canada that earned a berth in this weekend's Copa America final. \"For those who remain from the old guard, it's beyond impressive that the national team is in another final.\"\n\nJulin lvarez put the Albiceleste ahead in the 22nd minute, controlling a long pass from Rodrigo De Paul, taking two touches to get away from Mose Bombito and slipping the ball through the legs of goalkeeper Maxime Crpeau for his ninth international goal.\n\nMessi redirected Enzo Fernndez's shot following a poor Ismal Kon clearance in off the face of Crpeau from 4 yards in the 51st for his first goal of the tournament. Messi has 28 goals in his last 25 matches for Argentina and 14 in Copa America play, three shy of the record. He has scored against 38 different nations.\n\n\"I wasn't sure if Enzo's ball was going to get in,\" Messi said. \"It was a reflex.\"\n\nOnly Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo with 130 has more international goals than Messi, who turned 37 on June 24. Iran's Ali Daei had 108 or 109 from 1993 to 2006, with a lingering dispute over whether a goal against Ecuador in 2000 occurred in a full international match.\n\nWith a victory on its independence day, Argentina extended its unbeaten streak to 10 games. The Albiceleste seek a record 16th Copa title when they play Uruguay or Colombia on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida.\n\n\"We have to enjoy every moment of what we're living,\" Messi said. \"I'm conscious that these are the last battles.\"\n\nTrying to string together Copa America titles around the 2022 World Cup championship, Argentina is trying to match Spain's feat of winning the 2008 and 2012 European Championships along with the 2010 World Cup. \"These are statistics. I'm not really interested about it,\" Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni said through a translator. The most important thing is to win.\"\n\nMaking his 38th Copa America appearance, Messi had missed Argentina's group stage finale with a leg injury and was subdued while playing 90 minutes in the quarterfinal win over Ecuador. He was much more agile and shot just wide in the 12th and 44th minutes. Lionel Messi and Argentina moved within one win of joining Spain as the only nations to win three straight major titles.\n\nEast Rutherford (US), Jul 10 (AP) Lionel Messi and Argentina moved within one win of joining Spain as the only nations to win three straight major titles.\n\n\"It's insane what this team has done, what the Argentina national team is doing,\" Messi said on Tuesday night after his 109th international goal sealed a 2-0 victory over Canada that earned a berth in this weekend's Copa America final.\n\nAlso Read | England vs West Indies 1st Test 2024 Live Streaming Online in India: Watch Free Telecast of ENG vs WI Cricket Match on TV.\n\n\"For those who remain from the old guard, it's beyond impressive that the national team is in another final.\"\n\nJuli\u00e1n \u00c1lvarez put the Albiceleste ahead in the 22nd minute, controlling a long pass from Rodrigo De Paul, taking two touches to get away from Mo\u00efse Bombito and slipping the ball through the legs of goalkeeper Maxime Cr\u00e9peau for his ninth international goal.\n\nAlso Read | On Which Channel Paris Olympics 2024 Will Be Telecast Live? How To Watch Summer Olympic Games Live Streaming Online? Check Viewing Options Of Multi-Sports Event in India.\n\nMessi redirected Enzo Fern\u00e1ndez's shot following a poor Isma\u00ebl Kon\u00e9 clearance in off the face of Cr\u00e9peau from 4 yards in the 51st for his first goal of the tournament. Messi has 28 goals in his last 25 matches for Argentina and 14 in Copa America play, three shy of the record. He has scored against 38 different nations.\n\n\"I wasn't sure if Enzo's ball was going to get in,\" Messi said.\n\n\"It was a reflex.\"\n\nOnly Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo with 130 has more international goals than Messi, who turned 37 on June 24. Iran's Ali Daei had 108 or 109 from 1993 to 2006, with a lingering dispute over whether a goal against Ecuador in 2000 occurred in a full international match.\n\nWith a victory on its independence day, Argentina extended its unbeaten streak to 10 games. The Albiceleste seek a record 16th Copa title when they play Uruguay or Colombia on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida.\n\n\"We have to enjoy every moment of what we're are living,\" Messi said.\n\n\"I'm conscious that these are the last battles.\"\n\nTrying to string together Copa America titles around the 2022 World Cup championship, Argentina is trying to match Spain's feat of winning the 2008 and 2012 European Championships along with the 2010 World Cup.\n\n\"These are statistics. I'm not really interested about it,\" Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni said through a translator.\n\n\"The most important thing is to win.\"\n\nMaking his 38th Copa America appearance, Messi had missed Argentina's group stage finale with a leg injury and was subdued while playing 90 minutes in the quarterfinal win over Ecuador. He was much more agile and shot just wide in the 12th and 44th minutes.\n\nMetLife's temporary grass surface appeared heavy, with water splashing and sand popping up during dribbles.\n\n\"It's has been a very difficult Copa Am\u00e9rica,\" Messi said, \"very competitive, bad surfaces, excessive heat.\"\n\nArgentina fans gathered in Times Square on the eve of the match and filled the streets on Manhattan before heading to MetLife Stadium. The crowd of 80,102 on a night with an 82-degree temperature and 82% humidity was overwhelmingly pro-Argentina, with only a few sections dominated by red-clad Canadian supporters.\n\nIt was among the biggest games for Canadian soccer, which went 0-6 in its only World Cup appearances in 1986 and 2022 and won its only major title at the 2000 CONCACAF Gold Cup. Argentina had beaten Canada 2-0 in the tournament opener on June 20.\n\n\"The tournament caught up with us a little bit,\" Canada coach Jesse Marsch said.\n\n\"There's been heat, there's been travel, there's been a lot of challenges. ... We're still at the beginnings of our process, right? Argentina's maybe had eight years together, seven years together with this team, and so we need to develop more players that can contribute so that we can also rotate in tournament play, because eventually the physicality and the fatigue can catch up with you.\"\n\nCanada star Alphonso Davies limped off in the 71st minute after his right leg was caught in a clean challenge with Gonzalo Montiel.\n\n\"He's getting an X-ray, so we're hopeful he's OK, but we're not sure,\" Marsch said.\n\nCanada had two shots on target: Jonathan David was thwarted by Emiliano Mart\u00ednez from close range in first-half stoppage time, and Mart\u00ednez made a kick save on Tani Oluwaseyi in the 89th.\n\n\"We started getting sloppy. We started getting away from the game plan,\" said defender Derek Cornelius, who exchanged jerseys with Messi.\n\nWhile Messi referred to \"last battles,\" Scaloni and fans hold out hope Argentina and Messi will return to MetLife for the 2026 World Cup final.\n\n\"We will never be the ones to close the door,\" Scaloni said.\n\n\"He can be with our team for as long as he wants to be.\" AP", Just coming six minutes into the second half, Messi deflected from mid-fielder Enzo Fernandez's pass.\n\nThis was the first goal for the Argentine talisman in this edition of the Copa America, taking his overall tally to 109 goals. The 37-year-old forward, who inspired the La Albiceleste to their third World Cup title a couple of years ago, has hinted on his final years in international football.\n\n\"I'm living it like I lived it in the last Copa America, in the last World Cup. These are the last battles and I'm enjoying them to the maximum,\" Messi told TyC Sports after the semi-final triumph.\n\nAlthough it's not clear whether Messi will play his last Copa America event, Argentina head coach Lionel Scaloni said their all-time highest goal-scorer can take his own time to decide his retirement.\n\n\"We have to leave him alone, he knows that we will not be the ones to close the door on him. He can stay with us as long as he wants, even when he retires...Let him decide what he wants,\" Scaloni said.\n\nArgentina are the defending champions of Copa America and will face either Uruguay or Colombia in the final on Monday (IST) at the Hard Rock Stadium in Florida.\n\nWith his goal powering Argentina into their sixth Copa America final in the last eight editions, Lionel Messi became the second most goal-scorer in the international football arena. He surpassed former Iranian footballer Ali Daei's tally of 108 goals. {"uri": "2024-07-416928724", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "04:31:19", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T04:31:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T04:12:15Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7529411911964417, "url": "https://www.philstar.com/sports/2024/07/10/2369159/messi-says-he-enjoying-last-battles-argentina", "title": "Messi says he is enjoying 'last battles' for Argentina", "body": "From right: Argentina's forward Angel Di Maria, Argentina's defender Nicolas Otamendi (No. 19), Argentina's forward Lionel Messi and Argentina's defender Nahuel Molina (No. 26) celebrate after winning the Conmebol 2024 Copa America tournament semifinal football match between Argentina and Canada at the MetLife Stadium, in East Rutherford, New Jersey on July 9, 2024.\n\nEduardo Munoz / AFP\n\nEAST RUTHERFORD, United States - Lionel Messi said he was enjoying his \"last battles\" with Argentina after the 37-year-old found the net in a 2-0 win over Canada on Tuesday (Wednesday Manila time) to book a place in the Copa America final.\n\nAfter a lackluster display against Ecuador in the quarter-finals, Messi looked back to himself again, connecting with Angel Di Maria and strike partner Julian Alvarez, who also scored.\n\n\"I'm living it like I lived it in the last Copa America, in the last World Cup....these are the last battles and I'm enjoying them to the maximum,\" he told TyC Sports after the win set up a meeting with Uruguay or Colombia in the final.\n\nMessi, now playing with Inter Miami in Major League Soccer, has yet to indicate whether he will continue to play with Argentina in the 2026 World Cup, which will feature a final at the New Jersey venue.\n\nBut asked about Messi's \"last battles\" comment, Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni asked for calm.\n\n\"We have to leave him alone, he knows that we will not be the ones to close the door on him. He can stay with us as long as he wants, even when he retires...Let him decide what he wants,\" he said.\n\nMessi has chance to win a third straight major title with his national side following their 2022 World Cup triumph and their 2021 Copa America win.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner referenced veteran team-mates Di Maria and Nicolas Otamendi and said that the success was validation for the difficult barren years the team had suffered.\n\n\"The truth is that it's crazy what this group has done, what the Argentina national team has been doing, because after all this it gives value to all (the tournaments) I and the old generation have played in,\" Messi said on TyC Sports.\n\n\"It's not easy for us to be in a final again, for us to compete again to be champions,\" he added after the victory at MetLife Stadium.\n\nDespite Argentina reaching the final with some comfort against Canada, the former Barcelona forward said it had been a tough test so far.\n\n\"It's a difficult Copa, evenly matched, with very bad pitches, with high temperatures, very tough teams, and for us to be in a final again is something to enjoy,\" he said.\n\nGoalkeeper Emiliano Martinez said that despite being world champions the joy of reaching a final was just as intense as ever.\n\n\"It's a source of pride as an Argentine, as a representative of this national team, to be able to play in another final. {"uri": "8219255728", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "19:03:47", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T19:03:47Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T19:03:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7529411911964417, "url": "https://sports.yahoo.com/messi-had-argentina-reaching-copa-185943345.html", "title": "Here is what Messi had to say about Argentina reaching Copa America final, his future", "body": "Argentina is back in the Copa America final and Hard Rock Stadium is guaranteed a Miami-style fiesta Sunday night (and a fun-filled weekend leading up the game) as Lionel Messi and his talented teammates take on either Colombia or Uruguay in what will likely be the last appearance in the historic tournament for the 37-year-old icon.\n\nArgentine fans have been traveling to all their Copa games, taking over downtown Atlanta and Times Square in New York City, filling 80,000-seat NFL stadiums. A sellout crowd is expected on Sunday with the cheapest tickets listed at $1,200. A halftime show by Colombian singer songwriter Shakira makes it an even hotter ticket.\n\nMessi scored his first goal this tournament on Tuesday night as Argentina knocked off surprise semifinalist Canada 2-0 at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey. It is the sixth time Argentina makes the championship game in the past eight international tournaments it played in.\n\nLa Albiceleste reached the final of the 2014 and 2022 World Cups, and the Copa Americas in 2015, 2016, 2021, and 2024. The only two championships in the last eight that Argentina did not reach were the 2018 World Cup and the 2019 Copa America.\n\n\"It's crazy what this group has done, what the Argentine national team has been doing,\" Messi said to a group of reporters after the semifinal victory. \"After this, much more importance will be given to all the finals I played in, and to all the older generation players, me, Fide [Angel DiMaria], Ota [Nicolas Otamendi] and that Argentina can play another final is amazing. We must enjoy everything we are experiencing together as a group. What we have achieved is very difficult.\n\n\"To be honest, it has been a difficult tournament, the level has been as equal as ever, very bad surfaces, high temperatures that make it hard to play, very tough rivals. So, the fact we made it and we are here again playing a final is something to enjoy and highlight.\"\n\nAnd, this time, for a change, the team has not relied entirely on Messi.\n\nSure, the Argentine captain and Inter Miami star is still the face of the team and the absolute leader in the locker room and on the field. The players line up behind him in the tunnel before games like soldiers behind their general. At least one teammate has Messi's face tattooed on his torso.\n\nBut Argentina reached the semifinal without Messi scoring a single goal. He made nice passes, drew in defenders and created scoring opportunities for others. But the weight of the country was not fully on his shoulders.\n\nHis one goal was not the spectacular kind that has made highlight reels for decades.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner scored after Enzo Fern\u00e1ndez's shot deflected off Messi, who redirected it with a slight move of his foot, making it a tougher shot for Canada goalkeeper Maxime Cr\u00e9peau to save.\n\n\"I told Enzo it was not my intention to take the goal away from him, but I saw the goalkeeper fell down, the ball was going in slowly and I got my foot on it and redirected it a little bit,\" Messi said. \"The important thing is we scored.\"\n\nThe world is getting a glimpse of how this new-look Argentina team can continue to dominate in the twilight of Messi's career.\n\nMessi will be able to play in this final because of the performances of Emi Martinez, Lautaro Martinez, Alexis MacAllister, Julian Alvarez, Enzo Fernandez, Rodrigo DePaul, and others. His longtime teammate Angel DiMaria, 36, has said he will retire after this Copa America, making Sunday's game extra special.\n\nDi Mar\u00eda made his international debut in 2008 and has scored 31 goals in 144 appearances. Messi made a point in his pre-game speech to his teammates to dedicate the semifinal to DiMaria.\n\n\"Before we went onto the field Leo said they wanted to reach the final for me and that made me very proud,\" Di Maria said.\n\nAlthough Messi is a year older, he is not ready to call it quits on the national team just yet. If his body cooperates, it would not be far fetched to see him in the 2026 World Cup.\n\n\"As I've said before, I intend to continue,\" he told reporters on Tuesday night. \"I intend to keep living day by day without thinking about what will come in the future or whether I'll continue or not. It's something I just live each day. I'm 37 years and only God knows when the end will be.\"\n\nBut for now, he is living in the moment.\n\n\"Let's enjoy what we are experiencing as a national team, as a group. It is not easy to be in a final again, to compete again to be champions,\" Messi told TyC Sports. \"I'm living it as I have been living everything lately: enjoying it very much.\"\n\nDiMaria is ready to move on and has been asked about it during every Copa America interview.\n\n\"It's my last battle; there's nothing left to say that I haven't said a lot of times before,\" Di Mar\u00eda said. \"It's my last game. I want to thank all Argentineans and to this generation that has allowed me to lift so many trophies. It has been an honor.\"\n\nArgentina coach Lionel Scaloni was not ready to say farewell to DiMaria.\n\n\"We don't want to start crying right now. We don't want to feel sad,\" Scaloni said. \"We have to let him play and then we'll see if we can convince him or not to stay with us.\"\n\nSouth American World Cup qualifying resumes in September.\n\n\"We will never be the ones to close the door,\" Scaloni said about DiMaria. \"He can be with our team for as long as he wants to be. And if he wants to retire but still come and hang around, it would be great. And if he wants to come with me to somewhere else, I will take him everywhere so he can decide whatever he wants to do.\"", "source": {"uri": "sports.yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Yahoo He has scored against 38 different nations.\n\n\"I wasn't sure if Enzo's ball was going to get in,\" Messi said.\n\n\"It was a reflex.\"\n\nOnly Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo with 130 has more international goals than Messi, who turned 37 on June 24. Iran's Ali Daei had 108 or 109 from 1993 to 2006, with a lingering dispute over whether a goal against Ecuador in 2000 occurred in a full international match.\n\nWith a victory on its independence day, Argentina extended its unbeaten streak to 10 games. The Albiceleste seek a record 16th Copa title when they play Uruguay or Colombia on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida.\n\n\"We have to enjoy every moment of what we're are living,\" Messi said. \"I'm conscious that these are the last battles.\" Trying to string together Copa America titles around the 2022 World Cup championship, Argentina is trying to match Spain's feat of winning the 2008 and 2012 European Championships along with the 2010 World Cup.\n\n\"These are statistics. I'm not really interested about it,\" Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni said through a translator.\n\n\"The most important thing is to win.\"\n\nMaking his 38th Copa America appearance, Messi had missed Argentina's group stage finale with a leg injury and was subdued while playing 90 minutes in the quarterfinal win over Ecuador. {"uri": "8219044223", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:11:29", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:11:29Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:11:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7490196228027344, "url": "https://www.thedailystar.net/sports/sports-special/copa-america-2024/news/messi-enjoying-last-battles-argentina-3653806", "title": "Messi enjoying 'last battles' for Argentina", "body": "Lionel Messi said he was enjoying his \"last battles\" with Argentina after the 37-year-old found the net in a 2-0 win over Canada on Tuesday to book a place in the Copa America final.\n\nAfter a lacklustre display against Ecuador in the quarterfinals, Messi looked back to himself again, connecting with Angel Di Maria and strike partner Julian Alvarez, who also scored.\n\n\"I'm living it like I lived it in the last Copa America, in the last World Cup....these are the last battles and I'm enjoying them to the maximum,\" he told TyC Sports after the win set up a meeting with Uruguay or Colombia in the final.\n\nMessi, now playing with Inter Miami in Major League Soccer, has yet to indicate whether he will continue to play with Argentina in the 2026 World Cup, which will feature a final at the New Jersey venue.\n\nBut asked about Messi's \"last battles\" comment, Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni asked for calm.\n\n\"We have to leave him alone, he knows that we will not be the ones to close the door on him. He can stay with us as long as he wants, even when he retires...Let him decide what he wants,\" he said.\n\nMessi has chance to win a third straight major title with his national side following their 2022 World Cup triumph and their 2021 Copa America win.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner referenced veteran team-mates Di Maria and Nicolas Otamendi and said that the success was validation for the difficult barren years the team had suffered.\n\n\"The truth is that it's crazy what this group has done, what the Argentina national team has been doing, because after all this it gives value to all (the tournaments) I and the old generation have played in,\" Messi said on TyC Sports.\n\n\"It's not easy for us to be in a final again, for us to compete again to be champions,\" he added after the victory at MetLife Stadium.\n\nDespite Argentina reaching the final with some comfort against Canada, the former Barcelona forward said it had been a tough test so far.\n\n\"It's a difficult Copa, {"uri": "8219103352", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:55:39", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:55:39Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:55:13Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7490196228027344, "url": "https://gulfnews.com/sport/football/lionel-messi-says-he-is-enjoying-last-battles-for-argentina-1.103464567", "title": "Lionel Messi says he is enjoying last battles for Argentina", "body": "East Rutherford, US: Lionel Messi said he was enjoying his \"last battles\" with Argentina after the 37-year-old found the net in a 2-0 win over Canada on Tuesday to book a place in the Copa America final.\n\nGet exclusive content with Gulf News WhatsApp channel\n\nAfter a lacklustre display against Ecuador in the quarter-finals, Messi looked back to himself again, connecting with Angel Di Maria and strike partner Julian Alvarez, who also scored.\n\n\"I'm living it like I lived it in the last Copa America, in the last World Cup... these are the last battles and I'm enjoying them to the maximum,\" he told TyC Sports after the win set up a meeting with Uruguay or Colombia in the final.\n\nSecond-highest goal scorer\n\nMessi, now playing with Inter Miami in Major League Soccer, has yet to indicate whether he will continue to play with Argentina in the 2026 World Cup, which will feature a final at the New Jersey venue. The goal takes Messi as the second-highest active international goal scorer with 109 goals, only behind Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo (130).\n\nBut asked about Messi's \"last battles\" comment, Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni asked for calm.\n\n\"We have to leave him alone, he knows that we will not be the ones to close the door on him. He can stay with us as long as he wants, even when he retires... Let him decide what he wants,\" he said.\n\nValidation for the difficult barren years\n\nMessi has chance to win a third straight major title with his national side following their 2022 World Cup triumph and their 2021 Copa America win.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner referenced veteran teammates Di Maria and Nicolas Otamendi and said that the success was validation for the difficult barren years the team had suffered.\n\n\"The truth is that it's crazy what this group has done, what the Argentina national team has been doing, because after all this it gives value to all (the tournaments) I and the old generation have played in,\" Messi said on TyC Sports.\n\n\"It's not easy for us to be in a final again, for us to compete again to be champions,\" he added after the victory at MetLife Stadium.\n\nTough test so far\n\nDespite Argentina reaching the final with some comfort against Canada, the former Barcelona forward said it had been a tough test so far.\n\n\"It's a difficult Copa, evenly matched, with very bad pitches, with high temperatures, very tough teams, and for us to be in a final again is something to enjoy,\" he said.\n\nGoalkeeper Emiliano Martinez said that despite being world champions the joy of reaching a final was just as intense as ever.\n\n\"It's a source of pride as an Argentine, as a representative of this national team, to be able to play in another final. It feels as if it was the first time,\" he said.", "source": {"uri": "gulfnews.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "GULF NEWS"}, "authors": [{"uri": "agence_france_presse@gulfnews.com", "name": "Agence {"uri": "8218204327", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "07:22:37", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T07:22:37Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T07:22:21Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7450980544090271, "url": "https://www.nwaonline.com/news/2024/jul/10/messi-scores-argentina-advances-to-final/", "title": "Messi scores, Argentina advances to final", "body": "EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. -- Lionel Messi scored his 109th international goal and first of the tournament, leading defending champion Argentina over Canada 2-0 on Tuesday night and into the Copa America final.\n\nJulian Alvarez put Argentina ahead in the 22nd minute and Messi redirected Enzo Fernandez's shot in off the face of goalkeeper Maxime Crepeau in the 51st. Messi has 28 goals in his last 25 matches for Argentina and 14 in Copa America play, three shy of the record.\n\nOnly Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo with 130 has more international goals than Messi, who turned 37 on June 24. Iran's Al Daei had 108 or 109 from 1993 to 2006, with a lingering dispute over whether a goal against Ecuador in 2000 occurred in a full international match.\n\nWith a victory on its independence day, Argentina extended its unbeaten streak to 10 games. Argentina seeks a record 16th Copa title when they play Uruguay or Colombia on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida.\n\nTrying to string together championships in consecutive Copa Americas around the 2022 World Cup championship, Argentina is trying to match the feat of Spain when La Roja won the 2008 and 2012 European Championships along with the 2010 World Cup.\n\n\"It's insane what this team has done, what the Argentina national team is doing,\" Messi said. \"For those who remain from the old guard, it's beyond impressive that the national team is in another final.\"\n\nArgentina fans gathered in Times Square on the eve of the match and filled the streets on Manhattan before heading to MetLife Stadium, site of the 2026 World Cup final. The crowd of 80,102 on a night with an 82-degree temperature and 82% humidity was overwhelmingly pro-Argentina, with only a few sections dominated by red-clad Canadian supporters.\n\nIt was among the biggest games for Canadian soccer, which went 0-6 in its only World Cup appearances in 1986 and 2022 and won its only major title at the 2000 CONCACAF Gold Cup. Argentina had beaten Canada 2-0 in the tournament opener on June 20.\n\nCanada star Alphonso Davies limped off after his right leg was caught in a clean challenge with Gonzalo Montiel and he was replaced in the 71st minute.\n\nMaking his 38th Copa America appearance, Messi had missed Argentina's group stage finale with a leg injury and was subdued while playing 90 minutes in the quarterfinal win over Ecuador.\n\nHe was just wide from the top of the penalty area in the 12th minute after exchanging passes with Angel Di Maria, then wide again in the 44th and put a chip over the crossbar in first-half injury time.\n\nMetLife's temporary grass surface appeared heavy, with water splashing and sand popping up during dribbles.\n\n\"It's has been a very difficult Copa America, very competitive, bad surfaces, excessive heat,\" Messi said.\n\nArgentina went ahead after Rodrigo De Paul from the center circle played a long pass to Alvarez, who took a touch at the top of the arc to control the ball from Moise Bombito. Alvarez took another touch to create space from Bombito and from near the penalty spot slipped the ball between the legs of Crepeau for his ninth goal in 35 international appearances.\n\nMessi scored following a throw-in. He centered the ball to De Paul, who ran to the end line and cut the ball back. Kon\u00e9's attempted clearance went to Fern\u00e1ndez, who teed up a shot that Messi redirected from just inside the 6-yard box.\n\n\"I just put myself in the middle of it,\" Messi said. \"I wasn't sure if Enzo's ball was going to get in. It was a reflex.\"\n\nJonathan David was thwarted by Emiliano Mart\u00ednez from close range in first-half stoppage time, and Martinez made a kick save on Tani Oluwaseyi in the 80th.\n\nEUROPEAN CHAMPIONSHIP\n\nSPAIN 2, FRANCE 1\n\nMUNICH -- Lamine Yamal, 16, became the youngest player ever to score at the European Championship when he netted a stunning goal for Spain in its semifinal 2-1 victory over France on Tuesday.\n\nYamal will turn 17 on Saturday, a day before the final in Berlin against either England or the Netherlands.\n\n\"I only ask to win, win and win,\" said Yamal, who was voted player of the match. \"I will celebrate my birthday in Germany with my team.\"\n\nYamal struck in the 21st minute, curling the ball past France goalkeeper Mike Maignan from around 25 yards and into the top left corner.\n\n\"I don't know if it is the best goal of the tournament, but it is the most special goal for me because it is my first goal with the team at a European Championship,\" he said.\n\nYamal is 16 years and 362 days old. The previous youngest scorer at a European Championship was Swiss player Johan Vonlanthen (18 years, 141 days), against France at Euro 2004.\n\n\"We are very happy to reach the final. Now comes the most important part -- winning the title,\" Yamal said. \"We were in a difficult stretch after not expecting to concede so early. I just took the ball and wanted to put it right there.\n\n\"I don't try to think about it too much, just enjoy myself and help the team, and if it goes my way, then I am happy (for the goal) and for the win.\"\n\nArgentina's Lionel Messi is congratulated after scoring his side's second goal against Canada during a Copa America semifinal soccer match in East Rutherford, N.J., Tuesday, July 9, 2024. (AP Photo/Adam Hunger)\n\nArgentina's Lionel Messi gestures during a Copa America semifinal soccer match against Canada, in East Rutherford, N.J., Tuesday, July 9, 2024. (AP Photo/Adam Hunger)\n\nArgentina's Lionel Messi, left, vie for the ball with Canada's Derek Cornelius during a Copa America semifinal soccer match in East Rutherford, N.J., Tuesday, July 9, 2024. (AP Photo/Julia Nikhinson)\n\nArgentina's Julian Alvarez celebrates scoring his side's opening goal against Canada during a Copa America semifinal soccer match in East Rutherford, N.J., Tuesday, July 9, 2024. It is not easy to be in a final again, to compete again to be champions,\" Messi told reporters.\n\n\"I'm living it as I have been living everything lately: enjoying it very much and being aware, as it happens to Fideo (Di Maria) and Ota (Otamendi), that these are the last battles.\"\n\nArgentina have won a joint record of 15 Copa titles and reached the final six times in the past eight editions.\n\nBut Canada caused them real problems in the opening 20 minutes, with Jacob Shaffelburg twice shooting wide from promising positions.\n\nAfter soaking up the early pressure, though, Argentina went ahead when Rodrigo De Paul played through Alvarez.\n\nHe ghosted between two defenders to score with a tidy finish in the 22nd minute.\n\nArgentina, the 2022 World Cup winner and number one in FIFA's rankings, gradually took control, and Messi should have doubled their lead in the 44th minute.\n\nThis was when he created space in the penalty box with some silky footwork before lashing his effort wide.\n\nCanada nearly snatched an equaliser against the run of play in first-half stoppage time as Jonathan David sneaked in ahead of his marker to get on the end of a long throw-in.\n\nBut his close-range shot was hit straight at goalkeeper Emiliano Martinez.\n\nMessi had struggled with a muscle injury earlier in the tournament but appeared revitalised on a humid evening at the MetLife Stadium.\n\nHe scored Argentina's second in the 51st minute, sticking out a boot to divert Enzo Fernandez's shot from the edge of the area past Canada goalkeeper Maxime Crepeau.\n\nThe goal moved Messi to joint fifth in the all-time Copa America scoring charts, level with Peru's Paolo Guerrero and Chile's Eduardo Vargas on 14.\n\nHis 109th goal for Argentina also saw him surpass Iran's Ali Daei to take sole possession of second place on the all-time international scoring charts.\n\nMessi trails only Cristiano Ronaldo, who has scored 130 goals for Portugal.\n\nDespite their two-goal cushion, Argentina had a nervy finish to the match. Canada substitute Tani Oluwaseyi tested Martinez with a crisp shot in the 89th minute before directing a glancing header wide a minute later.\n\nFor Canada, the defeat ended a remarkable run in which they defied expectations.\n\nThey also performed better than their higher-ranked CONCACAF rivals, Mexico and the US, their fellow co-hosts of the 2026 World Cup.\n\nREAD ALSO: Intl Friendly: Messi set to lead Argentina against Nigerias Super Eagles\n\n\"They're the best team in the world, but at the same time, we had our chances in the beginning of the game,\" midfielder Stephen Eustaquio told reporters.\n\n\"If we scored one of our chances, the story of the game would probably have been different. {"uri": "2024-07-416945670", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "04:59:43", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T04:59:43Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T04:55:30Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7372549176216125, "url": "https://www.malaymail.com/news/sports/2024/07/10/messi-says-he-is-enjoying-last-battles-for-argentina/143240", "title": "Messi says he is enjoying \"last battles\" for Argentina", "body": "MIAMI, July 10 -- Lionel Messi said he was enjoying his \"last battles\" with Argentina after the 37-year-old found the net in a 2-0 win over Canada on Tuesday to book a place in the Copa America final.\n\nAfter a lacklustre display against Ecuador in the quarter-finals, Messi looked back to himself again, connecting with Angel Di Maria and strike partner Julian Alvarez, who also scored.\n\n\"I'm living it like I lived it in the last Copa America, in the last World Cup....these are the last battles and I'm enjoying them to the maximum,\" he told TyC Sports after the win set up a meeting with Uruguay or Colombia in the final.\n\nMessi, now playing with Inter Miami in Major League Soccer, has yet to indicate whether he will continue to play with Argentina in the 2026 World Cup, which will feature a final at the New Jersey venue.\n\nBut asked about Messi's \"last battles\" comment, Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni asked for calm.\n\n\"We have to leave him alone, he knows that we will not be the ones to close the door on him. He can stay with us as long as he wants, even when he retires...Let him decide what he wants,\" he said.\n\nMessi has chance to win a third straight major title with his national side following their 2022 World Cup triumph and their 2021 Copa America win.\n\nThe eight-time Ballon d'Or winner referenced veteran team-mates Di Maria and Nicolas Otamendi and said that the success was validation for the difficult barren years the team had suffered.\n\n\"The truth is that it's crazy what this group has done, what the Argentina national team has been doing, because after all this it gives value to all (the tournaments) I and the old generation have played in,\" Messi said on TyC Sports.\n\n\"It's not easy for us to be in a final again, for us to compete again to be champions,\" he added after the victory at MetLife Stadium.\n\nDespite Argentina reaching the final with some comfort against Canada, the former Barcelona forward said it had been a tough test so far.\n\n\"It's a difficult Copa, evenly matched, with very bad pitches, with high temperatures, very tough teams, and for us to be in a final again is something to enjoy,\" he said.\n\nGoalkeeper Emiliano Martinez said that despite being world champions the joy of reaching a final was just as intense as ever.\n\n\"It's a source of pride as an Argentine, as a representative of this national team, to be able to play in another final. "Lionel Messi was on target for Argentina in the 2-0 win over Canada to guide them into the final of the 2024 Copa America.\n\nThe defending champions produced arguably their best performance of the competition with a dominant showing to qualify for a second consecutive final.\n\nManchester City forward, Julian Alvarez put Argentina in the lead in the 22nd minute with a low key finish following good work from Rodrigo Paul.\n\nThe trio of Angel Di Maria, Rodrigo Paul and Lionel Messi combined to devastating effect to rip Canada open at every opportunity but they were unable to add to their lead going into the break.\n\nSix minutes into the second half, Lionel Messi scored his first goal of the competition with a close range finish to make it 2-0 for Argentina.\n\nCanada failed to test Argentina goalkeeper, Emi Martinez until the last minute when Tani Oluwaseyi's effort was parried away from safety.\n\nLionel Messi was named the player of the match following another influential performance and he is on course to win a third consecutive trophy for Argentina after the Copa America in 2021, FIFA World Cup in 2022.\n\nHe has now become the only player to lead his country to eight major finals in the history of football after guiding them to five Copa America finals, two World Cup finals and Olympic football finals.\n\nThe 37-year-old revealed that he is enjoying his \"last battles\" as he closes in on rounding up an illustrious career.\n\nMessi said, \"I'm living it like I lived it in the last Copa America, in the last World Cup....these are the last battles and
